title: Latency issues
body: Hello, I am having latency issues these days. I live in Canberra and play LoL in Canberra, and I have been getting an increase in latency recently. When I play, I used to get around 20~30 ping, but now it stays at 450 ping every game. I checked that my internet speed was same as before. Sometimes, when I leave the game and come back, the ping becomes alright, but that costs me the lane every game. Also, sometimes leaving the game and reconnecting doesn't solve the issue. Could you please help me?

replies.body:
Hey,

The support article on [Troubleshooting Connection Issues](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/200169336-How-do-I-run-a-traceroute-) might be a good starting point.

Might also be good to run a trace route to 103.240.227.1 to check the path between you and the server.

Let me know how you go
Cheers
Mindstar

These are my results. Also, my brother, who uses the same internet as I, seems to have no problem while playing on the same time. I just hope there is a solution to this issue.

Traceroute has startedâ€¦

traceroute to 103.240.227.1 (103.240.227.1), 64 hops max, 72 byte packets
 1  192-168-1-1 (192.168.1.1)  87.763 ms  503.423 ms  4.079 ms
 2  cbr-apt-mar-bras2-lo-20 (10.20.22.235)  502.678 ms  613.119 ms  715.071 ms
 3  cbr-apt-mar-csw1-te-1-6 (203.213.56.13)  716.555 ms  24.745 ms  21.099 ms
 4  cbr-apt-mar-crt2-ge-1-0-0 (203.219.106.105)  23.216 ms  21.864 ms  22.466 ms
 5  syd-gls-har-crt2-te-0-0-0-3 (203.219.106.117)  26.320 ms  24.566 ms  24.726 ms
 6  syd-gls-har-dom1-be-20 (203.29.129.197)  24.932 ms  22.335 ms  23.616 ms
 7  203-219-106-254 (203.219.106.254)  29.158 ms  22.334 ms  71.275 ms

Hey,

From that trace I'd have a look at your connection to your router, or the router itself.  Do you connect over wifi by any chance?  Have you tried direct connecting with a cable or resetting the router?

For reference, this line is where I think the issue is highlighted: _1 192-168-1-1 (192.168.1.1) 87.763 ms 503.423 ms 4.079 ms_ 
It shows that your connection to your router is inconsistent.   Without knowing a bit more, I'd assume it is a sign of either Wifi interference or an overloaded/unstable router.  On a stable network, I'd expect to see this number to be a consistent ~1ms.

I'd suggest a router reboot and also try connecting with a cable.

Cheers
Mindstar
